"**Straight from the Heart** " is a song by Canadian rock musician [Bryan
Adams](/wiki/Bryan_Adams "Bryan Adams"). It was released in February 1983 as
the lead single from his third studio album, _[Cuts Like a
Knife](/wiki/Cuts_Like_a_Knife "Cuts Like a Knife")_. It was his breakthrough
song in the U.S., the first to make the [top 40](/wiki/Top_40 "Top 40"),
reaching number 10.[1] It also peaked at #32 on the [Adult
Contemporary](/wiki/Hot_Adult_Contemporary_Tracks "Hot Adult Contemporary
Tracks") chart, the first Bryan Adams single to appear on that chart.

##
Background[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Straight_from_the_Heart_\(song\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background")]

Adams wrote the song when he was 18 in the late 1970s. Although Adams did not
release his version of the song until 1983, the song was first recorded by
[Ian Lloyd](/wiki/Ian_Lloyd_\(musician\) "Ian Lloyd \(musician\)") in 1980, on
his album _Third Wave Civilization_.[2] Australian singer [Jon
English](/wiki/Jon_English "Jon English") recorded the song for his 1981
album, _[In Roads](/wiki/In_Roads "In Roads")_. The song peaked at number 72
in Australia. Later, the song was covered by teen band Rosetta Stone in 1982
(issued as a single in November that year, a month before Adams' version came
out as a single). Welsh singer [Bonnie Tyler](/wiki/Bonnie_Tyler "Bonnie
Tyler") released it on a 45 in the US in May 1983. It was featured on her 1983
album _[Faster Than the Speed of Night](/wiki/Faster_Than_the_Speed_of_Night
"Faster Than the Speed of Night")_.
